Class dom.session.CapabilityReceipt 

java.lang.Object
    |
    +----dom.session.CapabilityReceipt
final class CapabilityReceipt
extends java.lang.Object
Wrapper class to hold data for a DObject<->DObject presence capability request. The class protects access to the contained data by a) not letting the grantor change any of the fields except the myFacet field...which it can set only *once* through setFacet(aFacet) call. This is the only thing the grantor can do to this object other than get access to the info the receipt wraps. The class is declared final so no subclasses can be created. The constructor is declared protected so no untrusted code can make spurious instances of this class (only made by the View).

Author:
Scott Lewis
See Also:
requestDObjectCapability
Source Code:
CapabilityReceipt.java

Constructor Detail

CapabilityReceipt

protected CapabilityReceipt(View aView,
                            DObjectID requestor,
                            DObjectID grantor,
                            java.lang.String requestName,
                            java.lang.Object data)
Constructor declared protected so that untrusted code cannot make instances of these objects. Instances *only* made by the View object.
Parameters:
aView - the View that is making us
requestor - the DObjectID of the DObject making the request
grantor - the DObjectID of the DObject being sent this receipt
requestName - the name of the request
data - any Object data sent along with the request by the requestor
Throws:
NullPointerException - thrown if any of the first 4 parameters are null (they should not be).
Method Detail

getRequestorID

public DObjectID getRequestorID()
Get the DObjectID of the DObject that is making the request for a capability (i.e. the request initiator).
Returns:
DObjectID of the request initiator

getGrantorID

public DObjectID getGrantorID()
Get the DObjectID of the request grantor
Returns:
DObjectID of the capability request grantor (the target of the the capability request)

getRequestName

public java.lang.String getRequestName()
Get the String name of the request. This returns the name of the request passed in by the requestor, in the form of a String
Returns:
String that represents request name

getData

public java.lang.Object getData()
Get the data associated with the request. This is data that is passed in by the requestor as part of the request. The grantor can look at this data and do with it as it wishes (i.e. depending upon the request, this data might be some 'magic bits' that the grantor uses to decide whether or not to grant the request
Returns:
Object that is the data sent by the requestor as part of the request

setFacet

public void setFacet(DObjectFacet aFacet)
This method allows the grantor to give the requestor a facet. It takes any subclass of DObjectFacet.
Parameters:
newFacet - the DObjectFacet that the grantor is providing access to

getFacet

protected DObjectFacet getFacet()
Get the DObjectFacet that the grantor has stamped this receipt with. This is only used by the View.giveDObjectCapability method, hence its status as protected. This means that untrusted DObject code can never call this method, and must depend upon the View to get the facet out and provide it to the DObject (via the DObject.giveCapability message).
Returns:
DObjectFacet that has been given to this receipt (via the setFacet method above) by the capability request grantor

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Represent this capability receipt as a String. Mostly used for debugging.
Returns:
String that represents this capability receipt
Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object
